title: Add ES/FR/DE i18n with PT fallback, expand language dropdown, and update responsive footer references

requirements.summary: Extend i18n to support pt/en/es/fr/de with a guaranteed Portuguese fallback for missing translation keys.
acceptanceCriteria: The app recognizes five language codes: pt, en, es, fr, de.
If a translation key is missing in the active language, the Portuguese value is shown instead of rendering undefined/blank.
Switching languages does not change routing, app layout structure, or build configuration.

file_operations.description: Add ES/FR/DE language entries and ensure the exported Language type includes exactly: pt, en, es, fr, de. Add placeholder dictionaries for es/fr/de (partial is acceptable) while keeping Portuguese as the canonical full key set so it can act as the fallback baseline.

Implement safe translation fallback behavior by composing the active language translations over the Portuguese baseline (e.g., merge pt + active) so any missing key in en/es/fr/de resolves to Portuguese. Also harden initial language selection so an unknown stored value safely falls back to 'pt' without runtime errors.

requirements.summary: Update the language dropdown to always show PT/EN/ES/FR/DE with native names and switch UI language on selection.
acceptanceCriteria: The language selector dropdown displays five options: PT, EN, ES, FR, DE.
The currently selected language is reflected in the dropdown trigger (desktop shows native name; mobile shows the 2-letter code).
Selecting ES/FR/DE works without runtime errors even if translations are placeholders.

file_operations.description: Expand the languages list to exactly five options (pt/en/es/fr/de) with appropriate native names (e.g., Português, English, Español, Français, Deutsch) and ensure selection calls setLanguage with the correct code. Use the existing shadcn-ui DropdownMenu/Button components to keep behavior consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a professional footer references line linking to ENISA, CISA, CNCS, and Europol while preserving existing credits and ICP section.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer still shows the existing 'by HCoragem' credit.
Footer still contains the existing Internet Computer/ICP reference section already present in the UI.

Footer includes the exact text line (localized or in English if not localized yet): 'References public cybersecurity advisories from:' followed by ENISA (EU), CISA (USA), CNCS (PT), Europol (EU) as clickable links to: https://www.enisa.europa.eu/, https://www.cisa.gov/, https://www.cncs.gov.pt/, https://www.europol.europa.eu/.
No certification/audit badges or official certification seals are added (text links only).

file_operations.description: Add a new translation key for the footer references prefix text (managed via translations per constraints), e.g., 'References public cybersecurity advisories from:' (English is acceptable). Ensure the key exists in pt and can be optionally overridden in en/es/fr/de.

Add a new footer line that renders: 'References public cybersecurity advisories from:' followed by text-only links to ENISA, CISA, CNCS, and Europol using the exact URLs provided. Preserve existing 'by HCoragem' and the ICP credit section, and do not add any badge/seal imagery (links only).

requirements.summary: Ensure language selector and footer remain fully responsive and any icons/images used are served from frontend public /assets.
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, the footer content wraps/aligns without overflow or overlapping elements.
On desktop screens, footer content remains readable and properly spaced.
Any images/icons referenced by these components resolve under /assets/ (including existing /assets subfolders) and render crisply at 16x16px when used as small icons.

file_operations.description: Adjust footer layout classes to support wrapping and readable spacing across breakpoints (especially when the new references line is added), preventing overflow/overlap on mobile while keeping a clear horizontal layout on desktop. Keep existing icon image sources under /assets (e.g., /assets/generated/icp-logo-icon.dim_16x16.png, /assets/generated/haveibeenpwned-icon.dim_16x16.png, /assets/generated/phishtank-icon.dim_16x16.png).

Validate responsive trigger behavior remains correct with five options (desktop shows native name; mobile shows code) and that no non-/assets images are introduced. Continue using the existing shadcn-ui dropdown primitives; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
